data.title: Arsenal steps up Osimhen pursuit
data.meta_description: Arsenal has reportedly stepped up efforts to sign Napoli striker, Victor Osimhen, offering a higher transfer fee than Paris Saint-Germain but with a lower salary package, according to Radio Radio. The Nigerian international has been widely expected to leave Napoli this summer, following the signing of a new contract in December 2023 that included a …
data.text:
Arsenal has reportedly stepped up efforts to sign Napoli striker, Victor Osimhen, offering a higher transfer fee than Paris Saint-Germain but with a lower salary package, according to Radio Radio.

The Nigerian international has been widely expected to leave Napoli this summer, following the signing of a new contract in December 2023 that included a substantial salary increase and a release clause set between €120-130 million.

However, with no club meeting Napoli’s initial asking price, the Italian side is now open to negotiating a lower figure. This development has sparked renewed interest from potential suitors, with Arsenal emerging as a strong contender alongside PSG.

While PSG was initially considered the frontrunner for Osimhen’s signature, Arsenal’s latest move has shifted the dynamics of the transfer saga.

The North London club is reportedly offering a higher transfer fee to Napoli, although the proposed salary for Osimhen is lower than what PSG can offer. Napoli is keen to expedite the transfer process, as it’s eager to offload Osimhen to facilitate its own transfer plans, including a potential move for Romelu Lukaku.

The Italian club’s ability to pursue new signings is contingent on finalizing Osimhen’s departure.

As negotiations continue, it remains to be seen whether Arsenal’s higher bid will be enough to secure Osimhen’s services, or if the player’s preference for salary will sway him towards PSG.

This developing situation promises to be one of the summer’s most intriguing transfer stories.
